alert.note: Alert for Northern Elko County; Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County; Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; South Central Elko County; Southeastern Elko County; Southern Lander County and Southern Eureka County; Southwest Elko County; White Pine County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 20 at 2:36AM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Rain and snow showers to continue across northern and central Nevada early this morning... Current radar imagery is continuing to show rain and snow showers across the area. Snow levels remain around the 5200 and 6500 foot level, depending on location. Webcams provided by the Nevada Department of Transportation is showing snow occurring at Emigrant Summit on I-80, as well as Robinson Pass on US Highway 50 in Eureka and Robinson Pass in Eureka and White Pine counties, respectively. In addition, a mix of rain and snow showers continue in the cities of Elko, Wells, and Jackpot. Look for the wet weather to continue through this morning with minor snow accumulations of one-half inch possible in the valleys, though some locations in central Nevada could see an inch or so. Early morning drivers should be aware of rapidly changing weather due to elevation. Please use caution as slippery road conditions are likely and use low beams during low visibility situations. Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information.
